alert.note: Alert for Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Oneida, northwestern Madison and central Onondaga Counties through 1030 AM EDT... At 1000 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lyndon, or near Syracuse, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Onondaga, Syracuse, Clay, Cicero, De Witt, Sullivan, North Syracuse, Solvay, Chittenango and Manlius. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 34A and 39. New York Interstate 81 between 16A and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
